cab.content: 1BATTLE SITUATION NOON - 9th JU1ME, 1918.1, After a heavy bombardment commencing at midnight the Germans attacked at dawn on a 40 kilometre front from MONTDIDIBRto nOYON, The French are holding the attack well on their main line of resistance the average penetration amounting to 2 or 3 kilometres. The general situation appears satisfactory.2, On the British front there is nothing of interest to report beyond indications of preparation for a small enemy attack South of YPRES.General Staff,War Office, S.W.I. 9th June, 1918.Issued at 12.50 p.m.
